title: How to Take off in a Cessna 172

steps.title: Line up with the runway.
steps.content: Line up with the runway. As you do so, ensure that the Directional Gyro matches the runway heading (Correction for the wind if there is crosswind). [1] X Research source

steps.title: Advance the throttle in about 3 seconds time all the way to full.
steps.content: Advance the throttle in about 3 seconds time all the way to full. (Check your mixture rich. [2] X Research source )

steps.title: As soon as plane starts moving, perform this visual check:
steps.content: As soon as plane starts moving, perform this visual check: Oil Pressure in Green Oil Temperature in Green

steps.title: Call out "Power available" (minimum 2300 RPM) and "Airspeed alive" when your Airspeed Indicator comes alive.
steps.content: Call out "Power available" (minimum 2300 RPM) and "Airspeed alive" when your Airspeed Indicator comes alive. This should occur somewhere around 35 KIAS (Knots Indicated Airspeed). [3] X Research source

steps.title: Pull back slowly on the yoke when 55 KIAS is reached.
steps.content: Pull back slowly on the yoke when 55 KIAS is reached. Rotate at 60 KIAS.

steps.title: Lower your nose once off the ground for the best rate of climb speed (75 KIAS).
steps.content: Lower your nose once off the ground for the best rate of climb speed (75 KIAS).
